results.title: Cyberdelia
results.credit_line:
Steve Spangaro, director
Mike Collins, associate director
Milena Romanin, production manager
Susan King, interviews and research
Based on an original concept by Adem Jaffers
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
Cyberdelia is a visceral encounter with the aesthetic and ideals of Melbourne underground cyber artists at the confluence of analogue and digital creative practice in 1991.

In blending artist interviews and works, this magazine style documentary explores visions of personal and cultural enhancement through transformative digital technologies. The imminent fusion of spirituality with technology; flesh with machine and psychedelia with cybernetics is confidently proclaimed.

Cyberdelia is a visual and aural feast with the film-makers channelling the post-modern mischief and transcendental yearnings of the ‘cyberdelic’ movement to radical stylistic effect. Stunning cyber artist works are liberally leveraged as both feature material and interstitial fodder. Low-budget analogue video editing and compositing tools are pushed to the limit while artist on-camera interviews are staged in bizarre fashion so as to maintain the feel of a ‘trip documentary’ from start to finish.

Produced for broadcast on community television station RMITV, Cyberdelia stretches the boundaries of arts documentary to portray the brazen idealism and micro-processor powered creativity of these pre World Wide Web visionaries.

Artists: Acid Death Bed, Misha Hollenbach, Troy Innocent (Cyber Dada), Natalie Jeremijenko, Adem Jaffers (Neuro), Jeff Jaffers (Third Eye), Dale Nason (Cyber Dada), Ollie Olsen (Third Eye) Captain ROM, Stelarc, Gus Till (Third Eye), Julian Wong, Christopher Wright and Max Q.

Cyberdelia was generously donated to ACMI by Cyberdelia Productions.

results.title: Triptych
results.brief_description:
This is the view overlooking Plac Wielkapolski (Great Poland Square), a busy intersection of pedestrian, tram, and other vehicle traffic adjacent to an open-air market. A meditation on an unfamiliar environment by an outside observer, and a response to the work of Zbignew Rybczynski and other members of the Lodz Film Form Workshop of the 1970’s.
In memory of Antoni Mikolajczyk, head of the studio of video and installation, who passed away last spring, a year after this material was shot in his studio. Shot over a twenty four hour period in early Spring 1999, during my stay as a visiting professor at the Poznan’ Academy of Fine Arts Studio of Video and Installation.

results.title: 'Screen It' 2015 [winning entries and special mentions]
results.brief_description:
‘Screen It’ was Australia’s national film, animation and game making competition for school-aged students, run by ACMI for 16 years to 2019.

Designed to encourage imagination and inventiveness in primary and secondary school students, ‘Screen It’ fostered a new generation of young media makers. In 2015 budding young film and game-makers took up the challenge of creating their own short film or game in response to the theme “Change”.

Witness first-hand the amazing winning entries of the 2015 Screen It competition!

results.title: Zembla
results.creator_credit: Katrina Salvadore and St Columba's College
results.brief_description: Zembla is a word derived from “zemblanity”, a term coined by the British author William Boyd to mean “the opposite of serendipity”.

results.title: Survival of the fittest
results.creator_credit: Tessa Laing and St Mary's Anglican Girls' College
results.brief_description: ‘Survival of the Fittest’ constructs the core message that human genetics should not be altered, despite good intentions. Based on a scientific theory by Herbert Spencer that relates to how organisms evolve over time to develop desirable traits. The film explores how scientists can artificially replicate a natural process, which can lead to a negative outcome.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tessa Laing and St Mary’s Anglican Girls’ College

results.title: Parents!
results.brief_description: Britannia Butwell believes her parents are embarrassing and wishes for an exchange. That is, until she meets Sandra Sandman. Could Sandra be able to change Britannia’s mind?

results.title: Novo
results.brief_description: After a catastrophic accident, a cloned boy aboard a spaceship finds himself lost in an unknown yet familiar place. He must come to terms with the change of lifestyle and adapt to it. Along the journey he meets some new friends and helps them as best he can.
